item.title: Area 5150 & The Demoscene
item.description: For those not familiar, the demoscene is a computer art subculture whose main focus is on producing self-contained audiovisual presentations for people to flex their programming, graphical or musical ability. It started sometime in the early 1980s and remained quite popular up until the early 2000s. Its’ popularity has fallen off somewhat in recent years, but it still continues today, with demos being released mostly at organised competitive events such as Evoke, a demoparty which is held annually in Cologne.
